wikipedia_page.main: William Huston Dodd (1844-17 March 1930) was an Irish politician, barrister and judge.  He held the Crown office of Irish Serjeant-at-law, sat in the House of Commons of the United Kingdom as member for North Tyrone,  and served as a judge of the High Court of Justice in Ireland from 1907 to 1924. There is a   sympathetic account of  his personality in  the celebrated legal  memoir The Old Munster Circuit by Maurice Healy.
